revised_title: Foliation and Cleavage Arrangement in Rocks of the North of Scotland
tldr: The author examines the arrangement of foliation and cleavage in rocks of the North of Scotland, specifically gneiss and mica schist. He observes that foliation often forms great arches with the inclination of layers increasing away from the center, and that this pattern is similar to the arrangement of cleavage planes in slates.
